Name: Cyclododecane
PMT-score Explanation: The PMT-score is based on an aggregation of the P, M and T-scores using the following formula: PMT-score = (P-score)^0.33 × (M-score)^0.33 × (T-score)^0.33.
P-score Explanation: This P-score is based on an aquatic environmental half-life of 21.6 days estimated using the BIOWIN3 model of EPISuite™ version 4.1.
M-score Explanation: This M-score is based on the chemical’s organic carbon/water partition coefficient (Koc) of 5.3 estimated using the KocWIN model of EPISuite™ version 4.1.
T-score Explanation: This T-score is based on alerts for the following human health related endpoints: carcinogenicity (c), mutagenicity (m), reprotoxicity (r) and endocrine disruption. Also, structural similarity to known cmr chemicals, classification of the chemical into one of the three Cramer classes and whether the chemical is a carbamate or an organophosphate is taken into account.
